TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UrlEditor extends System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a user interface for selecting a URL.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UrlEditor> is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> that provides a dialog box for selecting a URL.
## Examples [!code-cpp[WebUITypeEditorsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebUITypeEditorsExample/CPP/webcustomcontrol1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebUITypeEditorsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebUITypeEditorsExample/CS/webcustomcontrol1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebUITypeEditorsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebUITypeEditorsExample/VB/webcustomcontrol1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable ReadOnly Property Filter As String
protected: virtual property System::String ^ Filter { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the file name filter string for the editor. This is used to determine the items that appear in the file list of the dialog box.
Docs.value: A string that contains information about the file filtering options available in the dialog box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UrlEditor.Filter%2A> property specifies a filter string for all files (*.\*).
A filter string contains one or more filter options. Each filter option contains a description of the filter, followed by the vertical bar (|) and the filter pattern. The strings for different filtering options are separated by the vertical bar.
The following is an example of a filter string that contains two filter options:
"`Text Files (*.txt)|*.txt|All Files (*.*)|*.*`".
You can specify several filter patterns in a filter option by separating the filter patterns with semicolons. The following is an example of a filter string in which the first filter option specifies three filter patterns:
"`Text Files(*.txt;*.text;*.lst)|*.txt;*.text;*.lst|All Files (*.*)|*.*`".
